content: Not sure who to ask, but looking for field officers in Nevada to coordinate canvassing trips of around 20 people from California. Can someone point me to where I might find the right person with whom to coordinate?

(If you specify a city, then I can include the swing Congressional districts too.)  The [Senate campaign](https://act.rosenfornevada.com/a/join-team-rosen) is statewide, so you can signup to be a volunteer.
Thanks! I'm looking for Reno and Las Vegas.

[NV-01](https://www.mobilize.us/dinatitusforcongress/event/648282/) is a swing district.  Kamala's NV campaign also has events near [Las Vegas](https://events.democrats.org/?address=Las%20Vegas%2C%20NV%2C%20USA&lat=36.171563&lon=-115.1391009&org_ids=37122&q=Canvass).
Latinos Con Harris-Walz has a WhatsApp account, and AANHPIs For Harris likely will too.  Get [trained for WhatsApp](https://events.democrats.org/?q=WhatsApp) in-person.
## [Nevada Voter Information](https://www.vote.org/state/nevada/)

<a:star_wave:1269735420359606369> Hey, Team! We know you want to help make a difference! Did you know though that hosting a debate watch party is an amazing way to get involved and bring people together? <a:rainbow_heart_scribble:1269029739432120465> It’s all about good vibes, great conversations, and getting folks fired up for the election. Your watch party could be the spark that motivates someone to vote! <a:PinkFlames:1252802562659193004>  [Register your watch party](https://events.democrats.org/c/host-a-debate-watch-party/event/create/) to get access to all sorts of resources for throwing a successful debate watch party, including a [Host Information Session](https://events.democrats.org/event/677337/). <a:ThanksRainbow:1278765693579431967>
The state's [Volunteer Welcome](https://events.democrats.org/event/670222/) event

<@1274293080794595339> Democracy Docket also has a donate button at the top. Sorry, but we have to take it down for the same campaign finance rules.

**Strict Fundraising Rules (it’s the law):**
We can only fundraise on behalf of: Democratic National Committee, Harris Victory Fund or Harris for President directly. 
We can recruit for "non-official events" that are hosted by partner organizations or volunteers in ⁠non-official-events-only. We can recruit into anything that is listed on events.democrats.org or a state democratic party's mobilize.
Rule 3 Note > Relevance: Do not post links to petitions or other calls to action that haven’t been approved by Staff. This forum is not intended for debates. Additionally, do not attempt to raise funds or share fundraising links for any entity besides the Democratic National Committee. Using this server to raise funds for yourself, another candidate, or another organization violates campaign finance law and is strictly prohibited. Anyone who violates the rules is subject to removal or time out.
When in doubt, ask @Community Moderator.
FYI: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/rnc-trump-lawsuits-michigan-nevada-b2611991.html

Hello! Since we're in super-blue WA, we're looking for ways to get involved down there in NV. We're thinking of coming down for a few days, sometime between now and Election Day. What's the best place to find about events we could get involved in?

There's a bunch of out-of-state organized canvasses here: https://www.mobilize.us/2024nvvictory/?tag_ids=1507

but my strategy is just to troll the 2024 NV Victory mobilize generally! You can filter by date based on when you'll be there: https://www.mobilize.us/2024nvvictory/

I'm Steve Heitmann@WA, manager of the Stop Project 2025 voter outreach program. Resources: https://www.stop-project-2025.info/ Subscribe for free (subscribing automatically sends new posts to your email), We want to assist battleground states to elect Harris-Walz and Democrats, up and down ballot.

Please go to top menu/dashboard and click on Inform Voters to learm how the site can be used to inform voters. Also, please click on Democracy Activists--check out Card Campaign (and others). 

This has been sent to 406 chairs of county Democrats in 7 battleground states (WI, AZ, MI, PA, NV, NC, GA). The site has organically spread to 20 states.
Great, thanks!

Thanks for coming down to help us here in NV Washoe county is the swing county of our swing state so we need all the help we can get. The offices our here do voter registration during the week usually around 12 and door knocking and phone banking on the weekends.

Great! I am going to try schedule time to work remotely from NV some time in the next 4-6 weeks. I'l reach out to folks here when I have a better idea of the days so I can maximize my efforts. I'm hoping to help with voter registration and more group activities - it's always more joyful (for me) that way. I've canvassed in past elections and it always felt difficult/lonely/stressful knocking on doors by myself.

On this day 4 years ago, a record 3.3 million Americans cast their ballot early.  And as expected, only 1.7 million early votes have been cast (a 45% decrease).  Please use the link below or call the Democratic Voter Assistance Hotline 9am-9pm (EST) (1-833-336-8683) to request an absentee ballot, or make a plan to vote early or on election day.  https://iwillvote.com/

<:mega2:1269006580976976076> A reminder that we have a dedicated ⁠<#1288163431911788586> channel where we coordinate our efforts to post campaign content, leave comments, and upvote <:kamala1:1269028302203523114> <:WalzSmile:1270424129853456445> -related posts. Right now even supportive subreddits like r/politics are bombarded with Trump info, and we're trying to change that. Let's help people find information about our candidates and the brighter future they offer! Head on over to our channel and we'll plug you in with opportunities to contribute. Even if you have just one minute to help, you can make a difference.
Hello - is anyone able to help with knock on door canvassing location today in Las Vegas. I am out of state volunteer from California signed up for canvassing in Vegas today.

🗳️ 🗳️ 🗳️ 
<@&1245910626241351811>  Register to vote on paper by October 8 or online by October 22nd in Nevada to receive a mail ballot. Can you take a second today to make sure you and your network are all set to vote?
Here’s what you can do:

1. Reach out to everyone in your network with this message, that can also be found in Reach: 

Register to vote on paper by October 8 or online by October 22 in Nevada to receive a mail ballot! I’m reaching out to everyone I know to make sure their registration is up to date. This election is too important to miss. Will you check your registration status? Here’s the link: https://IWillVote.com/

2. Share this image on your social media! It can also be found in Reach! ✨ Make sure you’ve joined Reach for campaign updates here: https://app.reach.vote/join/7DRDMN
3. Check your own registration, at IWillVote.com. 
React with ✅when you’ve done it!
🗳️ 🗳️ 🗳️

Hey friends, four years ago, we sent President Biden to the White House with one of the largest popular vote margins in history, thanks to support from all 50 states, blue and red alike. A bigger margin makes it harder for Trump and MAGA Republicans to challenge the election. The work we do in these last two weeks is crucial.

Visit: https://iwillvote.com/
Call: Democratic Voter Assistance Hotline (833-336-8683)

Let's ensure Kamala Harris is elected!
Does that mean tabulating the candidate results or counting the number of absentee ballots received?
Hi Wendy.  Under current state law (N.R.S. AB 321, § 11, 13, 15), Nevada has now started counting absentee ballots.  Thats why its very important to deliver your ballot if you can
Thanks for the quick response.  Ready for another question?
Sure go ahead

Thanks!! I'm a California resident but am involved with GOTV for Nevada so it's helpful to understand NV law.  

From my reading of these NV web pages, residents can register and vote on the same day, if done in person at a polling location.  Can that be done during Early Voting and on Election Day or just on Election Day?   

https://www.nvsos.gov/sos/elections/election-information/same-day-registration
https://www.nvsos.gov/sos/elections/election-information/2024-election-information/-fsiteid-1
https://www.nvsos.gov/sos/elections/election-information/2024-election-information/2024-voting-locations
For the best answer you can go to Iwillvote.com or call the hotline mentioned above
